response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age (21, young adult)", "high", "Young age is associated with a higher propensity to recidivism."],
    ["Gender (Male)", "high", "Males statistically have a higher likelihood of reoffending."],
    ["Arrest History (2 arrests, no convictions)", "medium", "Multiple arrests indicate potential behavioral issues, although lack of convictions lessens the risk somewhat."],
    ["Education (High school diploma and currently in college)", "low", "Pursuing further education is a protective factor that can lower recidivism risk."],
    ["Employment (3 jobs in a year)", "medium", "Frequent job changes may suggest instability, contributing moderately to recidivism risk."],
    ["Substance Use (Marijuana use in past four years)", "medium", "Recent drug use contributes a moderate risk factor for future criminal behavior."],
    ["Living Situation (Living alone)", "medium", "Living alone may reduce social support, contributing moderately to recidivism risk."],
    ["Family Background (Raised in a two-parent household in a rural area)", "low", "A stable early family environment typically acts as a protective factor."],
    ["Religious Beliefs (Believes God influences personal life)", "low", "Religious or spiritual beliefs can provide a protective influence against recidivism."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 65
}

risk_factors: Young age is associated with a higher propensity to recidivism.
Males statistically have a higher likelihood of reoffending.
Multiple arrests indicate potential behavioral issues, although lack of convictions lessens the risk somewhat.
Education (High school diploma and currently in college)
Pursuing further education is a protective factor that can lower recidivism risk.
Frequent job changes may suggest instability, contributing moderately to recidivism risk.
Substance Use (Marijuana use in past four years)
Recent drug use contributes a moderate risk factor for future criminal behavior.
Living alone may reduce social support, contributing moderately to recidivism risk.
Family Background (Raised in a two-parent household in a rural area)
A stable early family environment typically acts as a protective factor.
Religious Beliefs (Believes God influences personal life)
Religious or spiritual beliefs can provide a protective influence against recidivism.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is a 21-year-old male who identifies himself as White. He has been arrested 2 times but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 11 inches and weighs 195 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is enrolled in a 2-year college. He has held 3 jobs during the year. He has used drugs in the past four years (marijuana) and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 5, in a rural area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
